words.def: A fleet, especially a fleet of Spanish ships which formerly sailed every year from Cadiz to Vera Cruz, in Mexico, to transport to Spain the production of Spanish America.
the time interval between the deposit of a check in a bank and its payment
at or on or to the masthead or upper rigging of a ship

a level tract of land

A unit of mass used in India, equal to the mass of a silver rupee coin, fixed at 180&nbsp;troy grain s in 1833, of a similar but slightly variable value before that date.
a singer whose voice lies in the alto clef
a globular water bottle used in Asia
